item.title: Introduction to Websocket
item.description: Intro WebSocket is a protocol (like HTTP) which defines how two parties can communicate. It is a technique for two-way communication over one (TCP) socket. A very good intro is written in this post How It Works WebSockets provide a persistent connection between a client and server. Once a WebSocket connection is established the connection stays open until the client or server decides to close this connection. With this open connection, the client or server can send messages to each other at any given time.
